cards.name: Xenoborg
cards.desc: With a mini-gun in one hand and a rocket launcher in the other, the Xenoborg is a failed hybridization of a Xenomorph and a cyborg.
cards.rules: Asimov. Once per turn, you may sacrifice a silicon card, and pay the difference between that card's summon cost and this card's summon cost to summon this card from your hand.

cards.name: Xenomorph Sentinel
cards.desc: The juices from a Sentinel's neurotoxin gland pair brilliantly with a Pan-Galactic Gargle Blaster.
cards.rules: Hivemind

cards.name: Xenomorph Drone
cards.desc: Rarely seen on the frontlines, the Drone is your average worker that lays the foundation of the hive.
cards.rules: Hivemind. Tap this card: you may summon a Xeno faction creature for 1 less mana this turn.

cards.name: Xenomorph Hunter (Resin Frontier)
cards.desc: A rare strain of Hunter that prioritizes slaying prey over infecting them.
cards.rules: If this card destroys a creature via combat, you may discard a card in your hand to add a card from your discard pile to your hand, whose summon cost is 2 or less.

cards.name: Xenomorph Spitter
cards.desc: While their acid gland is too dangerous to mix with alcohol (not that it stops the marines), a Spitter's acid is useful for industry as it can melt almost anything with ease.
cards.rules: Hivemind. Tap this card: draw the top 2 cards of your deck, you may re-arrange their order, then return them to the top of your deck.

cards.name: Xenomorph Runner
cards.desc: Running fast and dying faster, the sheer number of Runner corpses from a battle are enough to keep a research facility busy for years.
cards.rules: First Strike, Hivemind

cards.name: Xenomoprh Rouny
cards.desc: Rouny like go fast
cards.rules: Furst Stike, Hive mind

cards.name: Xenomorph Praetorian
cards.desc: The Praetorian is the Queen's royal guard, never seen far from the Queen's chambers.
cards.rules: Hivemind. If you have 2 or more other Xeno cards on your field alongside this card, you may sacrifice 3 Xeno cards and add Xenomorph Queen to your hand from your deck.

cards.name: Xenomorph Hivelord
cards.desc: The Hivelord is the last word in construction, capable of building entire hives in a matter of seconds.
cards.rules: Hivemind. For two mana, tap this card and summon a 0/2 Resin Wall counter creature. Each Resin Wall has Blocker.

cards.name: Xenomorph Boiler
cards.desc: The Boiler is a long-range artillery machine, capable of spewing clouds of acid that melt everything in seconds.
cards.rules: Hivemind. If this card attacks, it is tapped for an additional turn before it is untapped.

cards.name: Xenomorph Ravager
cards.desc: With large scythe claws for hands, the furious Ravager goes berserk at the sight of fire.
cards.rules: Hivemind, Fury

cards.name: Xenomorph Crusher
cards.desc: Extensive (and involuntary) field testing has revealed that a pulse rifle is unable to penetrate a Crusher's thick armored head.
cards.rules: Hivemind, Blocker

cards.name: Xenomorph Defender
cards.desc: The Defender's armored head crest makes an excellent makeshift shield.
cards.rules: Hivemind, Blocker

cards.name: Xenomorph Warrior
cards.desc: Warriors exhibit greater cruelty than other Xeno strains, enjoying snapping a victim's limbs before finishing them off.
cards.rules: Hivemind

cards.name: Xenomorph Queen (Resin Frontier)
cards.desc: The ruler of the hive. Organs from a Queen fetch a high price amongst researchers and less-than-moral surgeons.
cards.rules: For 2 mana, tap the equipped creature and summon a 1/1 Xenomorph Brood counter creature, with Hivemind.

cards.name: Xenomorph Carrier
cards.desc: Carriers are like the Easter Bunny except the eggs they hide will kill you.
cards.rules: Hivemind, Squad Tactics

cards.name: Xenomorph Defiler
cards.desc: Instead of utilizing eggs, the Defiler prefers to inject an unknown chemical in their victim, causing a devastating infection.
cards.rules: Hivemind. When this card attacks a target enemy creature, calculate damage as though the target creature has this card's power subtracted from it first.

cards.name: Predalien
cards.desc: No concrete information is available on this elusive creature as no one that has seen it has lived to tell the tale.
cards.rules: Hivemind, Changeling

cards.name: Xenomorph Shrike
cards.desc: It is unknown why Shrikes are able to lead a Hive, but their hives are always much smaller than a Queen's.
cards.rules: Hivemind. If Xenomorph Queen would be destroyed, you may re-equip Xenomorph Queen on this card instead, once per game.

cards.name: Xenomorph Bull
cards.desc: Popular in illegal rodeos, a Bull's horn can pierce a reinforced wall with ease.
cards.rules: First Strike, Hivemind

cards.name: Xenomorph Hivemind
cards.desc: Recently discovered to have sapience, this pulsating orb will dig into the earth and rapidly spread resin throughout planets.
cards.rules: Blocker

cards.name: Xenomorph Screecher
cards.desc: The Screecher's screeches are more psychologically damaging than the resulting hearing damage.
cards.rules: Deadeye

cards.name: Xenomorph Creep
cards.desc: This special Hunter strain prioritizes stalking its target. It evolves into a strain of Hunter that is (mercifully) rarely seen aboard space stations.
cards.rules: Tap this card: Until the start of your next turn, this card has immunity to Xeno Creatures.

cards.name: Chestburst
cards.desc: The xenomorph lifecycle begins with a chestburster- if you can't pick up on what this is from the name, congratulations! A life in the TerraGov Marine Corps may be the perfect career for you!
cards.rules: Destroy an enemy creature, and play a xenomorph card from your hand at half cost.

cards.name: TGMC Private
cards.desc:
I was a PFC
On a search patrol
Hunting lizards down
It was the Xeno Wars of '65
cards.rules: Squad Tactics, Oo Rah. While fighting a creature with 3 or greater power, TerraGov Private loses 1 power.

cards.name: Trusty Smokes
cards.desc: Sometimes, the best way to forget the horrors of war is with a quick smoke.
cards.rules: On Equip: the equipped unit gains Immunity to Battlefields.

cards.name: Sidearm
cards.desc: Remember: switching to a sidearm is faster than reloading. Shame pistol bullets don't penetrate xeno hide, though.
cards.rules: If an equipment card on your battlefield is destroyed, you may immediately play an equipment card from your hand to replace it (i.e. attach to the same unit) at half cost.

cards.name: Acid Rounds
cards.desc: For when you want to get shit done, and break several interspecies treaties while doing so.
cards.rules: When the equipped creature attacks another creature, any equipment attached to the opposing creature is destroyed.

cards.name: TGMC Smartgunner
cards.desc: Aiming is for nerds- get a smartgun today, and let the bloodbath begin!
cards.rules: Deadeye, Oo Rah

cards.name: Recruitment Propaganda
cards.desc: TerraGov needs you to fight (and die) for your planet! Sign up at your local recruitment office today!
cards.rules: Summon 2 1/1 Human Soldier counter creatures with Oo Rah.

cards.name: MRE Menu 7: Crayons
cards.desc: An important part of any Marine's balanced diet. Colouring book toilet paper not included.
cards.rules: Give a Soldier-type Creature +2/0 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Mothic Foreign Legion Marine
cards.desc: A soldier of the Mothic Foreign Legion, the elite fighting force of the Moths, and occasionally deployed alongside the TGMC to combat the xeno threat.
cards.rules: Oo Rah

cards.name: Mothic Foreign Legion Sniper
cards.desc: Moths are well suited to the job of sniping, as their natural inclination towards bright lights attracts them to their targets.
cards.rules: Oo Rah, First Strike

cards.name: Mothic Foreign Legion Gunner
cards.desc: In order to make use of heavy weapons such as the M56, Moth Soldiers are issued with a combat E.X.O. which braces the weight across their entire body.
cards.rules: Oo Rah. If more than 3 enemy creatures are attacking, Mothic Foreign Legion Gunner gets +1/+3

cards.name: ILA Expeditionary Force Marine
cards.desc: The ILA Expeditionary Force is the smallest division of the Imperial Army, and participates (begrudgingly) as a member of the anti-xeno coalition led by TerraGov.
cards.rules: Oo Rah. When attacking a Human opponent, this card gains +1/0.

cards.name: ILA Expeditionary Force Skirmisher
cards.desc: Within the Imperial Lizard Army, martial arts continue to play an important role in combat- from hand-to-hand to blades, the Lizards use them all, technological advancement be damned.
cards.rules: Oo Rah, Fury

cards.name: Ethereal Field Medic
cards.desc: Ethereals of the Nurturer caste frequently find themselves in the medical field- however, seeing them as field medics is a rarity, as most take a vow of pacifism.
cards.rules: Oo Rah. When a friendly Creature card is about to be destroyed, you may sacrifice Ethereal Medic to save it.

cards.name: Xenomorph Wraith
cards.desc: Marines who have the misfortune of meeting a Wraith don't leave a corpse. O-oo rah?
cards.rules: Hivemind, Immunity to Events

cards.name: TGMC Black-Ops Operative
cards.desc: While details of TGMC's black-ops during the Xeno Wars are now declassified, at the time these soldiers were among TerraGov's most closely guarded secrets.

cards.name: Synthetic
cards.desc: A precursor to the modern cyborgs that we know and love, Synthetics were designed to look human to disguise them from technophobic soldiers and crew.
cards.rules: Asimov

cards.name: Cimex Scuttler
cards.desc: Cimex Scuttlers are known for their extreme speed in rushing to the defense of the hive. Thankfully, once their shell is cracked, they're easy pickings.
cards.rules: Carapace

cards.name: Cimex Locust
cards.desc: The basic footsoldiers of the Cimex hive, Locusts can number in the thousands per hive, ready to swarm at a moment's notice.
cards.rules: Carapace. If attacking alongside two other Cimex Locusts, Cimex Locust gains +1/0.

cards.name: Cimex Basilisk
cards.desc: Acting as organic artillery, the Basilisk is capable of loosing a potent long ranged blast of heated stomach acid from its tail at any marine unfortunate enough to encounter it.
cards.rules: Carapace, First Strike

cards.name: Cimex Goliath
cards.desc: The vanguard of the Cimex hive, it's not afraid to use its head.
cards.rules: Carapace, Hulking

cards.name: Cimex Vampire
cards.desc: Vampires function as the main food collectors for the Cimex, draining blood from their victims to bring back to feed the others.
cards.rules: Carapace. When attacking an enemy creature, if Cimex Vampire defeats them, gain half the defeated creature's resolve as lifeshards.

cards.name: Cimex Manticore
cards.desc: With a giant tail and potent venom, the Manticore can kill a marine long after being killed itself.
cards.rules: Carapace, Toxic

cards.name: Cimex Tython
cards.desc: The Tythons act as the main broodcarriers of the Cimex Hive, birthing eggs and keeping them warm until they are ready to hatch.
cards.rules: Carapace. When Cimex Tython is destroyed in combat, spawn 2 1/1 Cimex Larvae token creatures.

cards.name: Cimex Ant
cards.desc: The Hive's builders and workers, Ants are crucial to the wellbeing of the Hive... and they pack a mean bite, too.
cards.rules: Carapace. For 2 mana, tap this card and summon a 0/3 Cimex Wall token creature with Blocker and Taunt.

cards.name: Cimex Chimera
cards.desc: The ultimate in Cimex warfare. When you hear the sound of beating wings, it's already too late.
cards.rules: Carapace, Flying

cards.name: Cimex Egg
cards.desc: Makes bad omelettes.
cards.rules: Blocker. Play this card tapped. When it is not tapped, you may sacrifice Cimex Egg to summon a Cimex card at half cost.

cards.name: Cimex Hive
cards.desc: Cimex Hives are sprawling networks of resinous, chitinous tunnels filled with hex-shaped combs bearing eggs. Also, they're filled with BUGS!
cards.rules: All non-Cimex units get -1/0. Cimex cards cost 1 less mana to summon, to a minimum of 1 mana.

cards.name: Fire at Will
cards.desc: Give them the lock, the stock, and two loaded barrels.
cards.rules: Grant all creatures on your battlefield Double Strike until the end of the turn.

cards.name: M42C Anti-Materiel Rifle
cards.desc: An old, yet capable rifle from the human/xeno wars, and one of Nanotrasens' finest weapons to date. Capable of punching clean through 2 inches of composite armour.
cards.rules: Grant the equipped creature Hulking.

cards.name: Friendly Fire Incident
cards.desc:
Marine One: Oh man, I just shot Marvin in the back.
Marine Two: Why the fuck did you do that?
Marine One: Well I didn't mean to do it, it was an accident!
cards.rules: Destroy a creature.

cards.name: VP78 'Protector' Combat Pistol
cards.desc: A classic Nanotrasen pistol, which used to be a common sight in the hands of upper management and their personal guards before the widespread adoption of lasguns within the corporation.
cards.rules: The equipped creature gains Deadeye.

cards.name: Cursed Legion Paratrooper
cards.desc: The 85th Airborne division of the TGMC is known as the Cursed Legion, due to their extreme misfortune in being present at every major defeat sustained by the TGMC during the human/xeno war. Despite their reputation, the unit is known for incredible valour and performance under stress, and those who survived are known as some of the toughest soldiers the TGMC has produced.
cards.rules: Death Defying

cards.name: Poisoned Tiziran Francisca
cards.desc: The Franciscas employed by the ILA are deadly on their own- but when coated with a deadly poison, they become a weapon few can survive an encounter with.
cards.rules: Grant the equipped creature Toxic.

cards.name: Cryopod
cards.desc: A common sight for long distance travel prior to the invention of bluespace-based Alcubierre drives, cryopods fell out of favour as FTL flight became faster and more economical. They're still seen on older ships, and typically most modern vessels will still maintain a cryobay in case their FTL engines fail.
cards.rules: Hex: the attached creature is placed in Stasis.
